title: The twins who tricked the Maya gods of death - Ilan Stavans

multiple-choice.question: What was the initial reason for the twin brothers, Jun and Wuqub, to be challenged by the lords of the underworld?

options.label: A
options.text: They had stolen food from the underworld.

options.label: B
options.text: They had disturbed the lords while playing ball.

options.label: C
options.text: They had refused to play the ballgame with the lords.

options.label: D
options.text: They had broken a statue of the lords.

multiple-choice.question: What happened to Junajpu after being bitten by a bat in the House of Bats?

options.label: A
options.text: He was cured by a magical plant.

options.label: B
options.text: He was left with a permanent scar.

options.label: C
options.text: His head was bit off by the bat.

options.label: D
options.text: He was forced to play the ballgame alone.

multiple-choice.question: What was the task that the lords of the underworld set for the twins in the House of Darkness?

options.label: A
options.text: They had to solve a puzzle.

options.label: B
options.text: They had to play the ballgame without any torch.

options.label: C
options.text: They had to return the torch unburnt.

options.label: D
options.text: They had to bring a gift to the lords.

multiple-choice.question: How did the twins manage to survive the House of Jaguars?

options.label: A
options.text: They ran away from the house.

options.label: B
options.text: They fought the jaguars with sticks.

options.label: C
options.text: They fed bones to the beasts.

multiple-choice.question: What was the purpose of the twins sending a mosquito ahead of them when they entered the great city?

options.label: A
options.text: To gather information about the city.

options.label: D
options.text: To play a trick on the lords.

multiple-choice.question: What was the final trick that the twins performed on the lords, which sealed their fate?

options.label: A
options.text: They pretended to kill each other and resurrect each other.

options.label: B
options.text: They performed a dance and sang a song.

options.label: C
options.text: They played a game of chess.

multiple-choice.question: What was the consequence of the lords' losing the ballgame to the twins?

options.label: A
options.text: They were forced to play again.

options.label: B
options.text: They were cursed by the twins.

options.label: C
options.text: They lost their power over the surface world.

options.label: D
options.text: They were banished to the underworld.

multiple-choice.question: What was the reason for the lords to burn the twins in an oven?

options.label: A
options.text: They were angry at the twins' trick.

options.label: B
options.text: They wanted to punish the twins for their victory.

options.label: C
options.text: They wanted to destroy the twins.

options.label: D
options.text: They were trying to kill the twins.

multiple-choice.question: How did the twins restore their lives after being burned in the oven?

options.label: A
options.text: They were resurrected by a magical plant.

options.label: B
options.text: They were brought back to life by the river.

options.label: C
options.text: They were revived by a seer.

options.label: D
options.text: They were healed by a doctor.

multiple-choice.question: What was the result of the twins' curse on the lords?

options.label: A
options.text: The lords were forced to play the ballgame forever.

options.label: B
options.text: The lords were banished to the underworld.

options.label: C
options.text: The lords lost their power over the surface world.

options.label: D
options.text: The lords were turned into animals.

title: The sleep disorder you might not know you have - Alayna Vaughan

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary cause of snoring?

options.label: A
options.text: Overactive muscles in the respiratory tract

options.label: B
options.text: Narrowing of the airway due to relaxed muscles

options.label: D
options.text: Increased airflow in the respiratory tract

multiple-choice.question: What is obstructive sleep apnea?

options.label: A
options.text: A type of snoring caused by blockages in the airway

options.label: B
options.text: A type of sleep disorder characterized by pauses in breathing during sleep

options.label: C
options.text: A condition where the brain temporarily fails to regulate the body's breathing

options.label: D
options.text: A type of sleep disorder caused by excessive relaxation of throat and jaw muscles

multiple-choice.question: What is the estimated percentage of adults affected by obstructive sleep apnea?
What is a common feature of people who suffer from obstructive sleep apnea?
What happens to blood vessels when a person experiences periods of low oxygen intake due to obstructive sleep apnea?

options.label: A
options.text: They dilate to get more oxygenated blood to vital organs

options.label: B
options.text: They constrict to get oxygenated blood to vital organs

multiple-choice.question: What is a common contributor to obstructive sleep apnea?
What is a treatment for obstructive sleep apnea?
What is the primary goal of treating obstructive sleep apnea?
What is a common complication of obstructive sleep apnea?
What is a common cause of central sleep apnea?

options.label: B
options.text: Excessive relaxation of throat and jaw muscles

options.label: C
options.text: The brain temporarily fails to regulate the body's breathing

options.label: D
options.text: Increased airflow in the respiratory tract

title: 3 secrets of resilient people - Lucy Hone

multiple-choice.question: What was the speaker's initial goal when they started studying resilience research at the University of Pennsylvania?

options.label: A
options.text: To develop a treatment for mental illness

options.label: B
options.text: To train American soldiers to be mentally fit

options.label: C
options.text: To study the effects of grief on individuals

options.label: D
options.text: To research the impact of trauma on communities

multiple-choice.question: What event occurred in 2014 that had a significant impact on the speaker's life?

options.label: B
options.text: A car accident that killed their 12-year-old daughter and her friend

options.label: C
options.text: A diagnosis of a serious illness

multiple-choice.question: What advice did the speaker receive from victim support after their daughter's death?

options.label: A
options.text: That they were likely to get divorced and experience mental illness

options.label: B
options.text: That they should focus on their other children and try to move on

options.label: C
options.text: That they would be able to recover quickly and easily

options.label: D
options.text: That they should seek professional help

multiple-choice.question: What strategy did the speaker use to help them cope with their grief?

options.label: A
options.text: They focused on their other children and tried to move on

options.label: C
options.text: They conducted a self-experiment using strategies they had learned from research

options.label: D
options.text: They ignored their feelings and tried to pretend everything was okay

multiple-choice.question: What is the term for the strategy of focusing on the good things in life?
What was the outcome of the study conducted by Martin Seligman and colleagues in 2005?

options.label: A
options.text: That people who focused on the good things in life experienced higher levels of depression

options.label: B
options.text: That people who focused on the good things in life experienced higher levels of gratitude and happiness

options.label: C
options.text: That people who focused on the good things in life experienced no change in their mental health

options.label: D
options.text: That people who focused on the good things in life experienced lower levels of happiness

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the strategy that involves asking yourself whether what you're doing is helping or harming you?
What is the purpose of the strategy of asking yourself whether what you're doing is helping or harming you?

options.label: A
options.text: To help you make decisions about what to do

options.label: B
options.text: To help you focus on the good things in life

options.label: C
options.text: To help you manage your emotions

options.label: D
options.text: To help you avoid making mistakes

multiple-choice.question: What is the term for the idea that resilience is not a fixed trait, but rather something that can be developed through practice and effort?

options.label: B
options.text: Resilience is a skill that can be learned

options.label: C
options.text: Resilience is a combination of both fixed and learned traits

options.label: D
options.text: Resilience is not a relevant concept

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker's message to people who are experiencing a difficult time in their life?

options.label: A
options.text: That they should give up and accept their situation

options.label: B
options.text: That they should try to move on and forget about their problems

options.label: C
options.text: That they should focus on the good things in life and try to develop resilience

options.label: D
options.text: That they should seek professional help

title: The secrets of the world’s most famous symphony - Hanako Sawada

multiple-choice.question: In what year did Ludwig van Beethoven's Symphony Number Five premiere?
Who was one of the first critics to liken Beethoven's Fifth Symphony to "glowing beams of light, piercing through the darkness"?
What style of composition was Beethoven experimenting with in his Fifth Symphony?
What is the name of the rhythmic motif that serves as the building block for most of the first movement of Beethoven's Fifth Symphony?
How did Beethoven's career choice as a freelance composer give him the flexibility to compose for self-expression?

options.label: A
options.text: By allowing him to compose for wealthy patrons

options.label: B
options.text: By giving him the ability to sell his music to publishers in multiple countries

options.label: C
options.text: By allowing him to compose for religious functions

options.label: D
options.text: By giving him the freedom to compose for self-expression

options.label: A
options.text: By using a new musical style

options.label: C
options.text: By creating a new rhythmic motif

options.label: D
options.text: By using a combination of all the above

options.label: A
options.text: It represents the composer's emotional state

options.label: B
options.text: It symbolizes the struggle between good and evil

options.label: C
options.text: It represents the figure of fate knocking at the door

options.label: D
options.text: It is a random musical pattern

multiple-choice.question: How does the fate motif create a sense of forward movement and signals doom in the first movement of Beethoven's Fifth Symphony?

options.label: C
options.text: By using a prolonged fourth note

options.label: D
options.text: By using a combination of all the above

options.label: A
options.text: It represents a message of hope

options.label: B
options.text: It represents a message of victory

options.label: C
options.text: It represents a message of defeat

options.label: D
options.text: It is a random sequence of dots and dashes

title: The simplest math problem no one can solve

title: What few people know about the program that "saved" America - Meg Jacobs

multiple-choice.question: What was the unemployment rate in the United States in 1932, marking the highest in the country's history?
Who was the Republican President in 1932, whose inability to turn things around led to his loss in the election?
What was the name of the comprehensive set of legislation proposed by Franklin D. Roosevelt to support struggling citizens and put the country back to work?
What was the name of the government agency created by Franklin D. Roosevelt to help farmers and educate them in improving planting techniques?
What was the primary goal of the New Deal's first priority, which was to stabilize the banks?

options.label: A
options.text: To provide loans to small businesses

options.label: B
options.text: To increase federal oversight of commercial banks

options.label: C
options.text: To create jobs for young men

options.label: D
options.text: To provide welfare assistance to citizens

multiple-choice.question: Which of the following was NOT one of the programs established by Franklin D. Roosevelt to help citizens afford groceries, rent, clothing, coal, and other necessities?
What was the name of the program that employed over 250,000 young men for projects like tree planting, irrigation, and fire prevention?
Which group was hit hardest by the economic downturn of the Great Depression?
What was the name of the law that was pushed by Eleanor Roosevelt but ultimately undermined by politicians who wanted to preserve white supremacy?
What was the outcome of the New Deal's policies, despite employing over 8 million Americans?

options.label: D
options.text: The country's mobilization for World War II

title: The epic of Gilgamesh, the king who tried to conquer death - Soraya Field Fiorio
